quest.name: Helping Hands
journal: At long last, the watcher is ready to fulfill his final duty.

The watcher would guide you to the facility housing the moon's crew, but the terrain is not easily traversed. To that end, he suggests seeking the aid of Argos to ferry you there. The moon's aetherial guardian is nowhere to be seen, however, and so the watcher suggests calling for him near the Crushing Brand.

You arrive at the Crushing Brand, but you have further yet to go. Your true destination is a nearby cavern, the Chlorophosgrot. The watcher believes the ambient aether there should allow Argos to take form.

The cavern is covered in lunar spongoi, which draw aether from the ground and disperse it into the air. There is not yet enough ambient aether in the area, however, and so the watcher asks you to spare a small portion of your own, to speed the process and help Argos to manifest.

After a few moments, a swirling mass of aether takes shape, and Argos appears in a flash of light. The aetherial guardian is as friendly as before and, perhaps sensing what is to come, creates reflections of himself, one for each of your companions. With that, your party is ready to cross the chasm and meet the moon's crew.

The watcher will accompany you no further, but he bids you heed the counsel of the moon's pilots, and prays for your success. And so you turn to your companions and the guardians which will deliver you to the other side of the chasm.

Erring on the side of caution, Y'shtola suggests the two of you cross first, with Thancred and Urianger following soon after. The plan decided, you soar over the chasm and arrive at last at the facility where the caretakers await. Wherever could they be?

As you enter into the facility, devices on the lower floor whir to life. They soon open, and from within diminutive rabbit-like creatures emerge in droves, a sight in violent defiance of all expectation. These are Hydaelyn's chosen pilots, however, so perhaps there is more to them than meets the eye.
objectives: Suffuse the lunar spongoi with aether.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The moon...is a ship? Well, now I've heard everything.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I should very much like to hear more of this extraordinary story...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It may be true, but others will struggle to believe it. I can scarcely believe it myself.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: The time is come for you to be on your way.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: The crater at the heart of Mare Lamentorum, where Zodiark was imprisoned, is not so easily traversed, however.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Let us call upon Argos, the familiar whom you met earlier. He should have no trouble bearing you across.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: As Hydaelyn created me as the gaoler, so too did She create Argos as the guard...

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: It is his nature to appear when needed, and yet he is nowhere to be found. Strange... Mayhap the imbalancing of aether has affected him.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Let us make for the Crushing Brand, and attempt to call upon him there.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: You need but recall the path you walked with Argos before, and you will find your way.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If he labors in service to Hydaelyn's plan, I see no reason not to do as he suggests. Shall we make for this Crushing Brand, then?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: With a little preparation, it might be possible to traverse the gap on foot.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Then again, it would be a long, long way down if one should slip... Perhaps another time.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Naught could prepare me for the boundless beauty of Etheirys. Shining, shimmering, amidst a sea of stars.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: A blue sapphire, and but one of countless other jewels brimming with life, no doubt...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: So close and yet so far. Does not the harsh terrain remind you of somewhere we've been before? The Dravanian forelands, aye.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A place that rejects the intrusion of outsiders. Where solitude reigns supreme... At the very least, it sounds suitable for Zodiark's prison.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: The place we seek is just ahead at the Chlorophosgrot.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: You see, Argos cannot manifest without sufficient concentrations of ambient aether.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: You would be hard-pressed to find a greater confluence than inside this cavern.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Follow me.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The guard of Zodiark's prison, eh? Blood red eyes, slavering maw, and built like a behemoth, I'd imagine. Let's hope he's friendly.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Curious... This place doth call to mind Pla Enni, home of the Nu Mou.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: This entire cave is thrumming with ambient aether...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Alas, any further analysis will have to wait.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Yes, here will do nicely.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: The lunar spongoi draw aether from the ground, which is then dispersed in the air. At present, however, the ambient energies are not quite sufficient for Argos to manifest.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Might you be willing to spare some of your own to help the spongoi along?

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Given time, the lunar spongoi would suffuse this space with sufficient aether, but we need not wait if you are willing to provide a helping hand.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Argos manifests in a flash. He seems glad to see you again.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: A most fascinating creation of Hydaelyn's, would you not agree? Should the need arise, he is even able to create reflections of himself on a whim.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Though I assure you it was no reflection which accompanied you earlier to the brand.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: No, Argos was quite eager to be at your side then, as he is now, it seems.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I cannot recall when last he showed such an affinity for anyone. Indeed, I thought him more likely to shy away from you and your companions.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Perhaps it was more than a sense of duty that compelled him to aid you before.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: As for your companions...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Unexpected, but greatly appreciated.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I believe we are all ready.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Then let us return outside that you may cross the chasm.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I was expecting something a little more intimidating and less...“man's best friend.”

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: To whom wouldst Hydaelyn entrust the command of so grand a vessel, I wonder?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Dalamud has long been described as the “loyal hound” of Menphina due to its relation to the greater moon...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It seems highly improbable─if not impossible─for ancient peoples to have known of Argos, but now I wonder whether there is some connection...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Argos favors you with what could almost be described as a conspiratorial grin.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Your destination is the structure there across the Cradle of Darkness.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: But climb onto Argos's back, and he will take care of the rest.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Once you arrive, it should not take long to find the ship's crew. The facility is designed to rouse them from their slumber in the event of Zodiark's destruction.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Heed their counsel. Together, you may guide the star and its people to a kinder fate.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: This is where we part ways. But know that I shall ever be watching and praying for your success.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Worry not for me. Real though I may appear as you and yours, I am but a part of this moon. A creation of Hydaelyn, entrusted with the memories of an acquaintance long dead, but not forgotten.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: My charge of Zodiark has ended, but so long as the moon exists, I shall not want for purpose.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I shall remain, ever watching, ever praying for your success.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Our ally's assurances notwithstanding, we cannot be certain what awaits us on the other side, so perhaps it would be best if we did not all go at once. I propose the two of us cross first while Thancred and Urianger wait here.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Ride Argos across the chasm?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Onward!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A malefic aether yet permeates from the crater. Remnants of Zodiark, most like.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Just a little further...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: This structure is enormous...though that is hardly surprising given the size of the average Amaurotine.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Apologies for the wait.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Right, then. Let us head inside and...oh?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Most intriguing. A means by which he conserveth energy, mayhap?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well, I certainly wouldn't want him to blink out of existence on our account, helpful as he's been.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Thank you, Argos. We'll take things from here.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Stay here where it's safe, all right?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If Argos is to remain without, let us not keep him waiting overlong.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Ride Argos and return across the chasm?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Truly a marvel beyond description.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Its scale is reminiscent of Amaurot, or rather, the replica we visited on the First.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Ride Argos across the chasm?
